results.title: Le Jeu de L'amour et du Hasard
results.brief_description:
Silvia is about to get married. On the eve of meeting her fiance, she obtains her father’s consent to try an experiment: in order to observe her husband-to-be and to chose him freely, she is to swap identity with her servant, Lisette. Monsieur Orgon, Sylvia’s father accepts knowing full well that Dorante, Sylvia’s fiance has made a similar request and traded places with his butler, Arlequin.

Credits: Director, Marcel Bluwal ; photography, Andre Bac.
Cast: Danile Lebrun, Jean-Pierre Cassel, Francoise Giret, Claude Brasseur.

results.title: Le grand siecle de Louis XIV = The great reign of Louis XIV
results.brief_description:
Episode 18 of Series “Il Etait Une Fois L’homme” (= “Once Upon a Time Man”).
A lot of time in this episode is devoted to the transformation of a simple hunting lodge into a palace worthy of the magnificence of Louis XIV. In 1680 Versailles is finally inaugurated after more than 20 years of work which calls upon the best talents of the time: Levaux, Lebrun, Lenotre, Hardouin-Mansart etc… Apart from a foray into French classicism in architecture, this episode also treats of the French religious conflict, opposing catholics and protestants.

Credits: Director, writer, Albert Barille ; photography, Jean-Louis Karcher ; art direction, Philippe Landrot, Rene Borg ; graphic research, Jean Barbaud.
Cast: Roger Carel, Francine Laine, Pierre Trabaud, Henri Djanik [original French narration].

results.title: Le Grand Pavois
results.brief_description:
Commandant Favrel is a navy officer married to the job. His naval career is spent training young recruits on ‘La Jeanne d’Arc’ during an eight months around the world ‘trip. Tension errupts in the Favrel household when Favrel’s wife starts begging him to quit the navy and lead a ‘normal’ life. Favrel agrees to a last trip on the ‘Jeanne’ during which he will be commanding Private Hardouin, a young man courting his niece Madeleine.

Credits: Producer, Andre Paulve ; director, Jack Pinoteau ; writers, Jean Raynaud, Jack Pinoteau, Roger Vercel ; photography, Roger Arrignon ; music, Henry Verdun ; assistant director, Claude Pinoteau.
Cast: Jean Chevrier, Nicole Courcel, Marc Cassot, Marie Mansart, Jean-Pierre Mocky, Maurice Sarfaty, Jean Murat.

results.title: Le Grand Ocean
results.brief_description:
Sixteen men decide to take part to the first around the world boat race. This documentary follows them for 8 months, from September 1973 to April 1974, across 3 oceans.

Credits: Directors, writers, Jean-Pierre and Daniel Millet ; photography, Georges Perenoud.
results.description:

results.title: Le Grand Jeu = the Full Deck
results.brief_description:
Scripted by frequent Feyder collaborator Charles Spaak, the film focuses on lawyer Pierre Martel, who runs up huge debts to help keep his mistress, Florence, in style. In order to avoid charges of embezzlement, Pierre signs up with the Foreign Legion intending to ‘forget’. Soon after he meets Blanche who reads cards and predicts he will be reunited with his beloved. Pierre begins keeping time with Irma, a prostitute suffering of amnesia, who looks strangely like Florence, only as a brunette. In order to accentuate the doubt of the hero obsessed by two women, similar in many ways, yet different, Feyder had Mary Bell’s voice as Irma dubbed by Claude Marcy. ‘Le grand jeu’ is one of Feyder’s more interesting. Its ‘realist-poetic’ sensitivity - seedy decors and world-weary characters - is greatly enhanced by wonderful performances, especially by Rosay.” Reference: Ginette Vincendeau, “The companion to French cinema”, London: BFI Publishing, 1996, p. 76. Robert Siodmak directed a re-make of ‘Le grand jeu’ in 1954.

Credits: Director, Jacques Feyder ; writers, Jacques Feyder, Charles Spaak ; photography, Harry Stradling ; music, Hanns Eisler ; art director, Lazare Meerson ; assistant director, Marcel Carne.
Cast: Pierre-Richard Willm, Mary Bell, Francoise Rosay, Charles Vanel, Georges Pitoeff, Pierre Larquey.

results.title: Le Grand Dadais = the Big Ninny
results.brief_description:
Alain Quesnard is a studious young man of twenty who lives with his mother. One day he meets Patricia, a model. For her and the pleasures she introduces him to he loses his head, his fiancee and finally his freedom. Reference: Film Index International.

Credits: Producer, Michel Cousin ; director, Pierre Granier-Deferre ; writers, Pierre Granier-Deferre, Betrand Poirot-Delpech ; music, Antoine Duhamel.
Cast: Jacques Perrin, Eva Renzi, Danielle Gaubert, Yvonne Clech, Harald Liepnitz, Yves Renier.

results.title: Le Francais par le film. No. 12
results.brief_description: Comprises twelve graduated lessons, each of which introduces a typical scene of French life and customs and stresses some part of French grammar. This episode centres around the French Customs Office and the docks ending with revision of grammar.

results.title: Le Francais par le film. No. 10
results.brief_description: Comprises twelve graduated lessons, each of which introduces a typical scene of French life and customs and stresses some part of French grammar. This episode centres around a train journey to another country and ends with sequences dealing with infinitives.

results.title: Le Francais par le film. No. 09
results.brief_description: Comprises twelve graduated lessons, each of which introduces a typical scene of French life and customs and stresses some part of French grammar. This episode centres around a journey by train and a schoolroom. Grammar teaching in this lesson refers to the subjunctive.
